snippet: The Nassau County district attorney said there was not enough evidence to support criminal charges in the sinking of a yacht last summer.
abstract: Nassau County District Attorney Kathleen Rice says no criminal charges will be filed in the capsizing of a yacht that left three children dead in Oyster Bay in July, 2012; Rice says investigation uncovered combination of circumstances that led to capsizing, but not enough evidence to support criminal charges against boat owner Kevin M Treanor.
lead_paragraph: The Nassau County district attorney said there was not enough evidence to support criminal charges in the sinking of a yacht last summer.

headline.seo: No Charges in Capsizing That Killed 3 Children
headline.main: No Charges in Capsizing That Killed 3 Children
headline.print_headline: No Charges in Capsizing That Killed 3 Children
